snippet: Dr. Thomas R. Frieden said that rapid response teams of experts will now be sent to any hospital in the country where an outbreak occurs.
abstract: Dr Thomas R Frieden, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention director, acknowledges for first time that quicker and more concerted action on agency's part might have kept Dallas nurse from contracting Ebola virus; says agency plans a more robust response to any future Ebola cases in American hospitals.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and JACK HEALY
byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting from Atlanta, Kevin Sack from Dallas, and Timothy Williams from New York.

lead_paragraph: Dr. Thomas R. Frieden said that rapid response teams of experts will now be sent to any hospital in the country where an outbreak occurs.

headline.main: C.D.C. Says It Should Have Responded Faster to the Dallas Ebola Case
headline.print_headline: C.D.C. Says It Should Have Responded Faster to the Dallas Ebola Case

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
